RockPro64: allow PCIe NVMe internal SSD
issue.body:
The RockPro64 board has a PCIe slot that can be used with a slim NVMe M.2 SSD drive. This makes attaching an external drive unnecessary and can allow for a nice compact form factor.

The partition naming scheme is a bit different. While on regular USB drives partitions are called e.g. `/dev/sda1`, on an NVMe drive the partition is called `/dev/nvme0n1p1` (note `p1` instead of `1`)

This commit extends the script `mount_drive.tcl` to
* recognize blockdevices starting with `nvme` in `findBlockDevices()`
* use the variable `$blockPartition` in `createMyNodeFsOnBlockDevice()` to allow for the different partition naming scheme

issue.title: Bitcoind crashed then didn't start on reboot
issue.body:
I'm currently running the Pi3b+ image from the website.

A few days ago bitcoind crashed (according to the web interface), so I tried rebooting. Then the website displayed the "starting up" message for a while. I left it for a day or so and checked again. No change. Checked the electrs.log and this was displayed:

Feb  6 02:17:02 myNode electrs[11033]: + '[' '!' -f /mnt/hdd/mynode/.mynode_bitcoind_synced ']'
Feb  6 02:17:02 myNode electrs[11033]: + echo 'Bitcoin not synced, sleeping for 60 seconds...'
Feb  6 02:17:02 myNode electrs[11033]: Bitcoin not synced, sleeping for 60 seconds...
Feb  6 02:17:02 myNode electrs[11033]: + /bin/sleep 60s
Feb  6 02:18:02 myNode electrs[11033]: + '[' '!' -f /mnt/hdd/mynode/.mynode_bitcoind_synced ']'
Feb  6 02:18:02 myNode electrs[11033]: + echo 'Bitcoin not synced, sleeping for 60 seconds...'
Feb  6 02:18:02 myNode electrs[11033]: Bitcoin not synced, sleeping for 60 seconds...
Feb  6 02:18:02 myNode electrs[11033]: + /bin/sleep 60s

So I figured bitcoind wasn't starting properly, since it wasn't showing the syncing screen in the browser. Tried to run bitcoind, but getblockchaininfo said it was starting an IBD again... The data is still on my hdd, and there appeared to be no issue with the hdd itself.

I then tried running bitcoind -reindex. It seems to be plugging along OK now, reindexing from the HDD data I assume?

Just wondering what may have happened? Something caused a crash that corrupted the index?

Cheers!

issue.title: Write Guide for Electrum over Tor
Does MyNode support fans for Raspberry Pi?
issue.body:
Hi there

I've running v0.1.74 on a Raspberry Pi 4 with 4GB of RAM, and the device is getting pretty hot during the initial block download. Right now I've just got aluminium heat sinks but I'm considering swapping them out for a fan like the one linked below.

I'm not particularly hardware savvy but from the limited I've read, it sounds like you need drivers on the Pi to operate the fan. However, I've flashed the SD with MyNode, so will the fan still work? Or are there alternate fans or cooling solutions I should consider?

https://www.pishop.co.za/store/fan-shim-for-raspberry-pi?keyword=fan&category_id=0

issue.title: Community donation Splitting
issue.body:
I notice Whirlpool (as well as VPN, and Remote Tor Access) shows as a premium feature. Since you will be earning Premium purchases from Samourai's hard work (among others), have you approached Samourai to discuss what an appropriate portion of the currently $99 premium should be donated back to support Samourai? I ask this not to stir up trouble but to point out that it looks bad, and Samourai might not be okay with it.

It should be possible to use Lightning to send Samourai a cut with every purchase on your side and publish clearly that you do so.  However, I'd prefer the user to choose the proportion of how much to donate to Samourai, RTL, Tor, etc.  
The myNode would be an ideal platform for recurring donations.  Have the node run a scheduled job every month to: Call "lnurl invoice" on each project the user wishes to donate to and auto-pay it from the wallet.
In this way you can request a donation to myNode and make other people's code included in Community Edition, avoiding any appearance of conflicts of interest by charging money for other people's code they already released.

issue.title: FEATURE: add BTCPay Server
issue.body: It would be nice to have BTCPayServer

issue.title: Keep Tor up-to-date
issue.body:
Debian Buster doesn't keep Tor up-to-date. With freshly installed and even after upgrade myNode we'll get tor 0.3.5.8 (one year old), lastest is 0.4.2.5

This should fix it. Tested on Rock64. Not sure about Raspbian.

Should worth it as onion v3 services comes with this and much more.

See:

https://blog.torproject.org/new-release-0425-also-0417-0406-and-0359

issue.title: LND Error on start
issue.body:
myNode version 0.1.84 on Raspberry Pi 4

After finishing quick sync, I was unable to create a lightning wallet due to waiting on the LND daemon to start.

Jan 30 16:48:08 myNode systemd[1]: Stopped LND Lightning Daemon.
Jan 30 16:48:08 myNode systemd[1]: lnd.service: Scheduled restart job, restart counter is at 1.
Jan 30 16:48:08 myNode systemd[1]: lnd.service: Service RestartSec=1s expired, scheduling restart.
Jan 30 16:48:06 myNode systemd[1]: lnd.service: Failed with result 'exit-code'.
Jan 30 16:48:06 myNode systemd[1]: lnd.service: Main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE
Jan 30 16:48:06 myNode lnd[3095]: /home/bitcoin/.lnd/lnd.conf:37: unknown option: nat
Jan 30 16:48:06 myNode lnd[3087]: + exit 0
Jan 30 16:48:06 myNode systemd[1]: Started LND Lightning Daemon.

To fix this I had to comment out `nat=false` in lnd.conf at line 37 under the autopilot section
